active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the effectiveness of overwriting (Clear) vs. physical destruction (Destroy) for different media types (e.g., HDD vs. SSD) in preventing data recovery, considering cost, time, NIST SP 800-88 guidelines, and real-world breach examples. Which method would you prioritize for high-confidentiality data and why? Address common misconceptions like 'deleting files is sufficient'.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Secure Data Disposal (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Secure Design Principles > Data Protection Design > Data Lifecycle Security > Secure Data Disposal). Use the following to generate 30 high-quality, spaced-repetition optimized flashcards: **Learning Objectives:** [Insert full learning_objectives array here] **Active Learning Tie-Ins:** Incorporate prompts from [discussion_prompt], [peer_teaching_activity], [problem_solving_exercise] into explanations. **Scaffolding:** Distribute cards across 4 layers: [Insert full scaffolding_layers here]. **Content Sources:** NIST SP 800-88 Rev. 1 (techniques: Clear/Purge/Destroy) & Rev. 2 (Draft: programs, validation, logical sanitization). Definitions: Media sanitization, irretrievability. Methods: Clear (overwrite), Purge (degauss/encrypt), Destroy (physical). Media: HDD/SSD. Compliance: GDPR. Breaches: Discarded drives. Sources: https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-88r1.pdf, https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/88/r2/draft. **Schema:** Follow [flashcard_schema] exactly. 10 basic_recall, 10 mcq (with distractors), 10 comparison. Balance Bloom's levels (5 lower: remember/understand; 15 mid: apply/analyze; 10 higher: evaluate/create). Ensure active recall, no hints on front. Output ONLY a valid JSON array of 30 flashcards matching the schema.
